# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(words::Vector{String}; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) <= text_width
            # Append the word to the current line
            current_line_length += length(word)
            push!(lines, string(lines[end]), " ", word))
        else
            # Start a new line with the current word
            current_line_length = length(word)
            push!(lines, "")
            push!(lines, string(lines[end]), " ", word))
        end
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
words = ["Here", "is", "a", "sample", "text."]
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The `wrap_string` function wraps a list of words according to the given `text_width`. It returns the wrapped text as a single string.

In the example usage, we create an array of words and call the `wrap_string` function with those words. The resulting wrapped text is then printed to the console.
